website_summaries.verdict: A good choice if you have limited counter space and are on a budget.
pros: Comes with 4 different attachments that are dishwasher safe
Most of the benefits of a stand mixer in a lighter, inexpensive model

customer_reviews.title: WARNING - THE MANUFACTURER HAS ALTERED THE PHOTOS OF THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: The manufacturer's photos showing the accessories nicely fitting below the mixer in the clear plastic container have been altered to hid the fact the electrical cord MUST also share that same space. This makes fitting both cord and accessories in the storage container almost impossible. The electrical cord in all of the photos from the marketing department at Cuisinart has magically disappeared. Had I been shown the truth, as shown in my photo, I would not have wasted my money for an expensive plastic container that now sits apart from the mixer. The Mixer works fine.
customer_reviews.author: ATP

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Mixer -- Broke in 38 Days!!
customer_reviews.text: This mixer broke in 38 days. The gears "stripped" while I was beating soft butter and sugar, and it will no longer hold one of the beaters nor beat with it. Absolute junk! I called the company and I have to pay $10 shipping for a new one and pay to ship the old one -- a huge fee for a mixer that lasted LESS THAN 6 WEEKS! Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Jayne R.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality & efficient little mixer!
customer_reviews.text: Love this hand mixer. I don’t agree with one of the reviewers regarding the container that came with the mixer... see picture attached.
customer_reviews.author: Practical Matters

customer_reviews.title: sub-par workmanship!
customer_reviews.text: Used twice and the right hand beater unit stripped out! I had to reurn it! Worked GREAT before it gave up the ghost. My Wife loved it!!! Need to find a more Quality Assuance manufatureer to build this for Cuisinart!!! All the other Cuisinart Items I have purchased over the years have stood the test of time and use!!
customer_reviews.author: frenchy1957

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not worth the money. Poor quality and craftsmanship
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been very disappointed with this mixer. After the first few times of using it, one of the beaters kept coming off during mixing. It happens every single time. I’m having to get a new mixer after having used this one just a handful of times. Worst mixer I’ve ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Amber LeClaire

customer_reviews.title: It Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Great mixer! High quality and I don’t know about the review of the person that couldn’t put it away neatly but I’ve used it a few times already and the pic shows how it stores afterwards. Maybe I should not trust one star reviews from people that doesn’t know how to use a product anymore...
customer_reviews.author: laurum

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous Beaters
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because of the handy storage features and have barely used it since purchased in 2016. However, went to cream sugar and butter at room temperature yesterday and one beater bent; the other beater blades came completely out of the base that attaches to the mixer body. Useless. I am lucky it didn't injure me. I have purchased many hand mixers over the past 30 years and spent much less money and never had one do this. A mixer at this price point should cream ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: Janelle

customer_reviews.title: Storage Case is Nice
customer_reviews.text: Cord and accessories fit inside the storage case just fine. Just turn the cord at one of the pre-determined angles and it will fit in the case with everything else. For storage put the back on first and then snap in the front end.
customer_reviews.author: DorfonGrass

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Mainly used for making chocolate chip cookie dough, something I've done with every portable mixer I've ever owned. Within a few uses something broke inside and beaters quit turning. Contacted Cuisinart and they promptly replaced it. Second was worse than the first, failed almost immediately. Same problem. Contacted Cuisinart hoping for a refund, since I didn't want to try again with a mixer that didn't work. They only fail when you are using them and then you are stuck with trying to finish the job without it...not fun. They couldn't issue a refund because I didn't buy from them, so I'm out over $60 and still don't have a mixer. Not a happy baker.
customer_reviews.author: Don Brynelson

customer_reviews.title: Good mixer!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mixer in April of 2018 and have used it many times since. It is a very powerful mixer for a handheld. I bought it mainly for cookies since my old mixer could not handle the thickness of the batter/dough mixture. This mixer works very well. It takes a little getting used to since it is variable speed but after only one use I could predict what it was going to do. The complaint that the mixer, cord, and utensils don't fit in the clear container is not a problem I have had; all seem to fit very well, and mixer snaps onto container. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara N. Dix

customer_reviews.title: Broke second use
customer_reviews.text: This mixer let me down big time! I spent a lot of time trying to find a hand mixer that would stand the test of time but didn't cost as much as a professional one. Second time out of the box I'm stuck at home during the Corona quarantine trying to make my baby's first birthday cake. Halfway through mixing some soft buttercream it starts clunking. Sure enough one side of the mixer won't turn anymore. I'm so disappointed! Now I'm trying to scramble to finish my boy's cake with limited options. 😔
customer_reviews.author: Jenni

customer_reviews.title: I love how I can put all the attachments in the ...
customer_reviews.text: I had a Cuisinart mixer for 15 years that had an unfortunate accident (somehow my son turned the mixer and it caught his shirt, kid is ok, mixer was not!) I had to find a mixer to make all the cookies I wanted to give out for Christmas! I love how I can put all the attachments in the attached box - AWESOME! And the plus side, when I run the mixer - you can hardly hear it, maybe on speed 4 or 5 it gets louder? I do my baking when everyone's sleeping, so this mixer is really quiet!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Gee

customer_reviews.title: I ended my lifelong love of KitchenAid and bought this Cuisinart.  I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this 9 speed mixer made by Cuisinart. I ended my lifelong love of Kitchen Aid and bought this Cuisinart. I love it so much, I bought my daughter the same model. Since I have always used Kitchen Aid, When my 20 year old 5 speed Kitchen Aid died I went to the KitchenAid products first. By all reviews the Cuisinart had far better features, reviews and price. The Kitchen Aid mixers were more expensive. I was delighted when I started using it. I love the power and ease of this model. I have 3 adults daughters who used it and loved it when visiting. Eventually I will gift them with one of their own.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl L.

customer_reviews.title: VERY NOISY
customer_reviews.text: I used this handheld mixer 1 time and had to give it away because it was so loud, I couldn't stand it. I went back to my very old Hamilton Beach/Proctor Silex 3 model 62330 that I had for more than 10 years, only comes with 3 speeds and is VERY QUIET. Although I liked the idea of the beaters and cord on the Cuisinart mixer being stored in a clear container that attaches to mixer, I found it was not easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: M Scalzi

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and Unbalanced Beater Blades
customer_reviews.text: After using this mixer three times the beater blades started wobbling and clinking. I have only mixed cake batters, nothing stiffer or thicker. I doubt it will handle pie crust. The mixer is nice although somewhat noisy, but the blades are thin and flimsy. They are also not as long as described or depicted. Because it is a Cuisinart I am disappointed in the quality of the blades. My old Sunbeam from WalMart had sturdier and longer blades. Other than the blades it is a nice mixer, but because of the blades I have to give it a 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wife likes it!
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a replacement for an older broken one. Works well, great for when you don't wanna get out the big brand-aid cuisine-art type mixer. I especially like the built-in blade 'n cord storage bowl. It can fall off, but I stuck a piece of electrical tape on it to make it a little tighter. Gotta really shake it to make it drop off now! It automatically starts on "low" might be useful to some, and 9 speeds? Slow medium fast, that's my speed. Great for cake batter, but I don't think it has the power for like bread dough and the like. Mama likes it!
customer_reviews.author: KC Rave

customer_reviews.title: Good mixer, but....
customer_reviews.text: No doubt, a well made mixer, but it does have some drawbacks. First, it's a little bit bigger than my old Hamilton Beech mixer. A little heavier too. And when I start it up, no matter how low the speed, it has a very brief speed spurt when I turn it on, even for a low speed. Finally, the cradle/tool holder that it sits in does not firmly lock the mixer into pace. So you have to use 2 hands to pick it up; otherwise the cradle falls away along with all the tools.
customer_reviews.author: AWF6019

customer_reviews.title: Love using it
customer_reviews.text: I really like this mixer. Now, I don't have to always use my big stand mixer. For some reason, I am having problems inserting the beaters. It takes me about 2 tries to get both of the beaters in so that they don't fall out. Some people mentioned having trouble getting the cord and the mixer to fit back in the container after using it - I refold the cord like it was when it arrived and it fits okay. I have to admit, it is something like doing a puzzle.
customer_reviews.author: So Cal Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Underwhelming
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews but I have been completely underwhelmed with this product. I purchased it based on the numerous positive reviews but upon receiving the mixer, 1 whisk attachment was missing. The attachments present don't seem especially strong, but have held up so far. I used the mixer for multiple Christmas cookie batches but the mixer seemed to struggle after adding flour, even on the higher settings. Additionally, the storage case does not "snap" into the machine as described - a quick jiggle instantly dislodges the case. Wanted to love this product, especially when I paid more when I could have gotten a similar product for a cheaper price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works.... However...
customer_reviews.text: It is compact with the storage system. The mixer definitely has bad attributes. 1. The storage system does not stay together. 2. It powers on with accelerated speed then slows. This causes a mess. So, make sure you start it out of the bowl. 3. It is extremely loud. I don't think any mixer should be so loud to do a job. That's all. I hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Great features and usable mixer
customer_reviews.text: Decent hand mixer. The features are great but the build quality is questionable. The plastic per button cracked and chipped off after a few months of use. The plastic cover also cracked. The item was not dropped and this occurred with normal use.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Remember to keep it out of the batter for the first few seconds when turning on
customer_reviews.text: My small mixer died so I was looking for a replacement. I do have a kitchen aid but there are lots of times I prefer a smaller mixer. This is perfect. I have not had a problem with the storage case like other reviews. I do agree with others that you have to remember when you first turn it on, it starts at a high speed and then slows down. Just keep it out of the batter when you turn it on. It is a great little mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Redrose

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart HM-905, What a beauty!
customer_reviews.text: The Cuisinart HM-905 Handheld mixer with storage case is the nicest handheld I have ever owned! I have struggled for years looking for the accessories to my mixer, in several drawers, pulling stuff out to find them. Now, all the accessories are within the attached see-through storage container! I just love it! I keep it on a shelf in my pantry, and it's actually very pretty for all to see! Whoever invented this storage container is a genius! Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: K. E. Russell

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent and cumbersome
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this as it was an "upgrade" from my previous mixer but the mixing is inconsistent; on every speed level it speeds up and slows down while in use. I have not used it for anything too complex yet but I would imagine making something like whipped cream will be near impossible with this mixer because of the inconsistent speed. It is a nice small and compact design but the storage base does not click on the mixer very easily plus the mixer falls over when I set it down while using (ie. to add more ingredients to whatever I'm blending or scrape the bowl).
customer_reviews.author: Lola

customer_reviews.title: Did not Last
customer_reviews.text: When I received this product 2 years ago, I loved it. After 2 years it no longer works. It has the same problem that is shown in one of the videos. The beaters are no longer spinning like they should. So, if you buy it, get the warranty or get something else. I will not buy one again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Speed control
customer_reviews.text: If you are thinking about whether you want a cuisinart 9 speed or kitchenaid 9 speed then go with the kitchenaid. It's much easier to maneuver and control. I run a small baking business and I am sorry I did not choose the kitchenaid. I do not like the inconsistent speed on the cuisinart plus it does not start slow like the kitchenaid. I would not buy a cuisinart product again. I bought this on September 26, 2019. Today it stopped working. Three months after buying . I do not recommend at all. Going back to kitchenaid.
customer_reviews.author: Vickie Barringer

customer_reviews.title: A good mixer
customer_reviews.text: I've had both the Cuisinart and the KitchenAid. I prefer this one. I'm not crazy about the digital speed control and wish it was just an old fashioned switch but it's still better than the KitchenAid.
customer_reviews.author: Astute Consumer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT MIXER
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a 35 year old KITCHEN AIDE Like most things I have had from CUISINART, this does the job well. Slow start prevent messes and at hi speed it whips cream in minutes The reviews that say the cord doesn't fit are inaccurate. Just coil up the cord, then stuff in the implements - NO PROBLEM. Once you figure that out, It's great to NOT HAVE TO shuffle through the drawer next to your stove to find the right attachment. I will say, however that I don't think I'll take it out to knead bread. I prefer my SUNBEAM stand mixer and my own two hands for that, though it could certainly knead something briefly, like biscuits.
customer_reviews.author: Oncearunner

customer_reviews.title: Not the quality I expected.
customer_reviews.text: The initial start up is higher than what it slows to. And when it is bogged down by a higher viscosity mix it overcompensates by reving higher. The 220 watts should be strong enough to start and maintain an even speed. Other mixers do so. The storage container does not stay attached to mixer in storage. The cord is the stiffest of any hand operated appliance in my kitchen. I would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: anderld47

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this mixer!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several mixers in the past and have not been happy with them but use them until they fall apart. I paid a bit more and purchased this mixer and love it. It's quieter than the previous, has 9 speeds that are just a push of the button, a cord that can be moved to the right, left or out the back of the mixer ......whichever is your preference to get it out of your way. And the storage container that comes with it is fantastic.......everything you need is at your fingertips. I would recommend this mixer very highly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best by Far!
customer_reviews.text: This is one great mixer! I bought it to replace my old Kitchen Aid that died. I intended to replace my old KA with another KA but when I read that the Cuisinart had a 220W motor compared to KA's 140W I decided on the Cuisinart. I am so happy with my choice. This mixer is quiet yet very powerful. Cleans up easy and the storage box for the accessories is handy and easy to attach. Be sure to read the instruction booklet...lots of information and care instruction.
customer_reviews.author: lnoll

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this mixer and I do like that it comes with several speeds (though I haven't had use for the highest speed). My only complaint is that the bottom storage tank does not stay on if you try to carry it from the cupboard to your countertop--you have to hold it together so that it doesn't drop off. I like that the cord stores in the bottom. However, we couldn't fit both the cord and the beaters in the storage case at the same time, so the beaters are stored in a drawer..
customer_reviews.author: Sharon S.

customer_reviews.title: Quality lightweight mixer with clever storage unit.
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I finally purchased a hand mixer. It is very useful for quick, light mixing jobs and saves me the trouble and mess of using my heavy mixer. Cleans up easily and so convenient. Especially enjoy the storage unit it clicks into. No having to hunt for the beaters and no loose cord getting all tangled up. I like how the cord connection can rotate in different directions, making it easier to store and good for left handed people as well. Has enough power for what I need. Gave one to my son and daughter in law after I tried it out for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Melisa Walker

customer_reviews.title: Maybe too powerful?
customer_reviews.text: I really like the mixer and the attachments are great. I appreciate the storage capability, as well. There are two things that really annoy me though: (1) the first setting “accelerates” incredibly fast before slowing to an appropriate speed. If you have a lot of liquid, prepare for the splash. (2) The ejection button SUPER ejects the beaters. Twice I’ve ended up with them being shot into the bowl rather than just releasing. I don’t like digging the beaters out of my mix.
customer_reviews.author: Cooking Nomad

customer_reviews.title: So nifty I have purchased 3!
customer_reviews.text: I found this at a local store and really loved it. My youngest daughter came by and admired it, so I bought her one from Amazon. My middle daughter came to help make banana bread and admired it, and got one for Xmas! The sturdy design, easy cleanup, cute storage bin, easily stored accessories and variable speeds make this a tool for both the novice and experienced cook/ Baker. Don't hesitate, it's well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: ThrillerReader

customer_reviews.title: but OMG it is so nice. I have a small kitchen and have to ...
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it a couple of times, but OMG it is so nice. I have a small kitchen and have to keep my big mixer in a lower cupboard. It is heavy and not easy to get onto the counter. This is compact and the clear holder keeps all the attachments in one place. It works great. It has enough power and is easy to use. I'm very glad I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Horseless

customer_reviews.title: Cord frays due to design flaw
customer_reviews.text: The design is great for storage but it bends the power cord awkwardly every time and within a year the cord was frayed, unless a newer, redesigned version has addressed this issue I’d not purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: C. Staples

customer_reviews.title: Well Built
customer_reviews.text: While I have a heavy duty Kitchen Aid stand mixer, I bought this to replace my Kenmore hand mixer which broke for smaller prep tasks. Read many reviews and this seemed to be better built than the Kitchen Aid hand mixer. The flat beaters on a lot of hand mixers don't hold up when preparing buttercream frosting. It also has a greater variety of speeds which lessens the splatter from liquids and flour. Also comes with dough hooks and a whisk. Works great . . . very pleased with the item.
customer_reviews.author: clvmprofesora

customer_reviews.title: Solid Little Handheld Mixer
customer_reviews.text: This is a functional mixer and I love the built in storage. So far, it has done a capable job of mixing cookie dough (regular beaters) and whipping egg whites into soft peaks (whisk attachment). Have not tried the dough hooks yet. The one thing to keep in mind is that they can toss the batter out of the bowl if your bowl is too shallow. A proper mixing bowl might be a future purchase for me.
customer_reviews.author: JoS

customer_reviews.title: Good but frustrating
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Only problems... 1) the cord is so tight next to the body of the mixer that it’s really hard to find a stable way to set it down upright on the counter. The cord tends to fold right under the mixer, making it topple. 2) the storage case that fits right under the mixer is good EXCEPT trying to hook it up so it doesn’t come apart. It takes several tries every time. There’s a slot at the end of the mixer where it’s supposed to go, but getting the rest of it to stay put so you can carry it around by its handle is a crap shoot. Very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Joan Cosper

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING! SO GLAD I BOUGHT THIS! A steal at this price!
customer_reviews.text: I was on the fence, because I had read mixed reviews. I am glad to say I went with my gut and purchased this mixer because of the brand, amazing discount and storage capabilities. It stores so easily with plenty of room. I have not encountered the issues of some that have placed a negative review for storage. It fits together perfectly with plenty of room. The mixer it self works like a charm. I have made hot cross bun dough with it, cupcake batter, cookie dough and whipped cream. Mixer handled it with ease. I love it! A steal at this price!
customer_reviews.author: Kiwi

customer_reviews.title: Space saver from Cuisinart
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for a big bulky Cuisinart stand mixer we had. This small compact, space saving mixer was just perfect for my needs. The fact that everything fit in a compact storage unit (including the cord) was the selling point for me. The instructions that came with the mixer are very helpful. I’m new at all this cooking, baking and kitchen stuff (widowed) especially since I’ve moved into a smaller more compact home.
customer_reviews.author: James Goodwin

customer_reviews.title: Broken on/off button
customer_reviews.text: I've had this mixer for about 6 months. The on/off button broke in half. It seems too pricey for something so basic to go wrong. I was happy with it up to now. This type of appliance takes a beating (no pun intended) working in a busy kitchen- as most are.
customer_reviews.author: frannieK

customer_reviews.title: Good heavy duty mixer
customer_reviews.text: Powerful motor. Does start a little fast, but not a big deal. Not too heavy, given its powerful motor. The accessories do not fir inside the clear plastic base, but the cord does. Very handy. Can't understand reviews here that down grade the mixer because of the online pic.
customer_reviews.author: Larry H

customer_reviews.title: A worthy appliance
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid choice for a hand mixer. It has sufficient power for all of our household needs. It has good accessories that are great for a full spectrum of tasks. The storage system is great conceptually and saves space, although it is sometimes difficult to close.
customer_reviews.author: Mark E. Tippery

customer_reviews.title: a beauty.
customer_reviews.text: i like the way it stores, everything together in one place.. no more searching and blaming the last one who unloaded the dishwasher that you can't find the beaters! i like the larger readout of the speeds and ejecting seems to be super easy and straight forward in operation.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy H.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a new hand mixer and one that would be self-contained in one spot. I liked the new two-piece set that has a bottom part that holds the tools so everything is kept together nicely! I ordered one prior to purchaseing this one, but didn't like the way the on/off switch worked. Had to return it. Then I ordered this one and loved it. I very much like the electric button that tells you what speed your on. Handles very nicley and everything stores in one place! Love It.
customer_reviews.author: J. Latini

customer_reviews.title: I returned this mixer
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed with the quality of this mixer. The design concept was good but the mixer attachments were too short Each time I used it, the food splattered everywhere. The attachments were very flimsy, in my opinion. I gave it three tries and then sent it back. I will just keep using my 25 year old sunbeam.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi Sabo

customer_reviews.title: Motor went out
customer_reviews.text: Product is horrible! I have had it for about a month and the motor already gave out. I’ve used it about 6 times for cupcakes. I’m really disappointed especially when it goes out I. The middle of mixing a cake. Tried calling cuisinart for customer support and no ones answers just a recording with 2 options
customer_reviews.author: Dannette Cortez

customer_reviews.title: I really thought I would like this mixer
customer_reviews.text: I really thought I would like this mixer. I read all the reviews for several different ones. It started smoking before I even finished a batch of cookies! I had to finish mixing by hand! This happening a couple of days before Christmas is frustrating! First time using a hand mixer smoking should never happen!! JUNK! I had several other issues that I didn't like about it before it started smoking! So extremely disappointed!!
customer_reviews.author: Joleen Annis

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase !
customer_reviews.text: I love this hand mixer. The beaters are strong and have a slow start feature...very nice. The accessories are so useful. I truly appreciate the case that organizes the mixer and accessories in one place. Good purchase. My daughter who has a $400 mixer, used mine on Christmas and said “This is fantastic!”
customer_reviews.author: Brenda J.

customer_reviews.title: I had one that started over heating from beating dough that was pretty thick. All in all
customer_reviews.text: I've owned 3 Cuisinart HM-90S mixers. The motor is powerful, and the mixer is well balanced. If I had one complaint, it would be the the socket for the beaters is poorly made. Every failure that I have had has been with the beaters falling out with continuous use. I had one that started over heating from beating dough that was pretty thick. All in all, I would buy again. They are good hand mixers, although they are not made for every task.
customer_reviews.author: BHG

customer_reviews.title: in fine condition, as described
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time, in fine condition, as described, and is working well. I would have given it 5 Stars, but it is $15 -$20 too high, and if you don't want to store the unsanitary cord inside the storage compartment with the mixing devices, you need to cut about a 1.25" x 0.3" notch in the back of the compartment so the cord can stick outside.
customer_reviews.author: Don S. S.

customer_reviews.title: Most powerful handheld mixer!
customer_reviews.text: I appreciate the high speed (9 speeds) for this handheld mixer! I have only used the beaters so far so can’t comment on the dough attachment. The eject lever easily removes the beaters; the clear case is a wonderful way to store attachments and keep the cord from straying when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Jarmer

customer_reviews.title: Good hand mixer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my vacation home, not wanting to buy another Kitchen aid stand mixer. I tried it on a large batch of heavy cookie dough and it did a pretty good job. A hand mixer can't compare to the stand mixer, but I am satisfied. The mixer is sturdy, doesn't tip over when placed on its end. I noted the increased speed of the motor when the machine is first engaged and made sure to compensate for that. This mixer did a much better job than my old light-weight hand mixer.
customer_reviews.author: S. M. Williams

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: This is my first hand mixer and I love it. Never had one so dont have anything to compare it to. The mixer does start off fast but quickly slows down. We used it last night to make brownies and cookies and everything came out great.
customer_reviews.author: Mario Estrada

customer_reviews.title: Wire beaters won’t cream butter
customer_reviews.text: This comes with wire beaters instead of the traditional style. (Also with dough hooks—why on earth would I need dough hooks on a hand mixer?). The wire beaters will not cream butter—the first step in most baking recipes. I also dislike having to push the “on” button, and then push the speed level button one, two, three, four, five, six, seven times to get it up to speed. The only thing I like is that the slow speed is actually slow and the fastest setting is good and fast. Will be looking to return.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Great little mixer
customer_reviews.text: Great hand mixer with a good storage box. The 9 speeds are well designed, specially the low 3 speeds, but I wish they didn't have that speed burst when it starts. It should be the other way around. it is a cute and light but powerful machine with good recipes written specifically for this mixer(not generic recipes) so they tell you which attachment and speed and duration of mixing to use for each recipe.... The only complain I have is the Chef's whisk looks pretty tiny. The one I saw and expected will com with it is the larger one. I'm checking with Cuisinart support on this. Maybe my unit has the wrong whisk...
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Last
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mixer in May 2019. I spent the extra money and thought I was getting a good mixer. I used it about one week ago and it was making a noise. Used it today and it totally quit working. My husband took it apart and said the plastic gears were broke and not fixable. I would think a hand mixer should last longer than one year. Very disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mother of Physics Genius

customer_reviews.title: a few flaws
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a fine product and a good value, though there are a few flaws. The attachment don't click into place easily and often fall out. Also, the I find it very difficult to attach the container to the mixer.
customer_reviews.author: JOSH K

customer_reviews.title: This works well.
customer_reviews.text: My only complaints with this mixer is that you can't easily set it back on the handle with the beaters over the bowl while grabbing other ingredients. Also, the cord and all attachments do not fit in the plastic cover. Other wise this works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Craig B.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this hand mixer!
customer_reviews.text: I had this for less than two years and it simply stopped working in the middle of mixing. The cord is very difficult to work with. The only good thing is the way it stores in its own container.
customer_reviews.author: LC Maine

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart has done it again!
customer_reviews.text: After 25+ years, my original hand mixer died and I did quite a bit of research for a new one. Having a few other Cuisinart pieces of equipment that are excellent and the added plus of the attachments and mixer in one self-contained container, along with a price I couldn't overlook, this 9-speed found a very useful place in this home. Lightweight, easy to operate and store, attachments for all needs (whisk/beaters/dough hooks). A great starter piece of equipment for some and a great replacement for others.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Ault

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job as a multi-speed blender
customer_reviews.text: The only thing to watch out for is when turning the blender on, it will overspeed and then slow back down to the selected speed. Otherwise it is perfect. The clear storage base is handy for keeping the attachments with the mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A., Philadelphia, PA

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this mixer!! I needed to replace my old one and bought a Cuisinart mixer, wasn't happy at all with it. Ordered this one and I'm totally satisfied with my choice. This mixer works hard, and well. The 9 speeds are very handy to have, I'll never get another brand again, love it!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: In love with the thought given to "how do I store this thing?"
customer_reviews.text: Too few products think about what we are going to do with the products when they're not in use. This one is so thoughtfully designed with storage in mind that I'm making an effort to give it five stars, which I normally don't do when I'm merely pleased (rather than delighted) with a product.
customer_reviews.author: vc

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product
customer_reviews.text: My mixer broke after many years and I debated on which one to replace it with. I was very pleased that I chose this one. I like the compact storage for the attachments. It works very nicely. In fact, I'm sorry I didn't purchase this sooner! It is very useful. A great addition to my kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Nibbles2014

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas present for a family member. She said she loves it. The low power option is great. It helps keep the splattering.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I love the compactness and the different power level mode. Used it to make whip up my mash potato and it has no problem going through 15 ilbs of it. Very impressive.
customer_reviews.author: stargazer

customer_reviews.title: Not Great.
customer_reviews.text: Really not the best mixer. I've had it about a year and it's already acting like the motor might die. The blades on the mixer are also a thin circular wire, rather than the usual flat blades... this makes the mixer less efficient and it seems to take longer to blend items to a smooth consistency. My advice is skip this product and save for something better.
customer_reviews.author: B.

customer_reviews.title: Barely lasted a year.
customer_reviews.text: It starts with a surge which sends your flour or sugar into the air, then it slows down. It doesn’t hold speeds and after just one year of use it stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: john kovatch

customer_reviews.title: It is now one year later and the beaters won't ...
customer_reviews.text: It is now one year later and the beaters won't stay in the plastic slots. It is also very difficult to get the mixer snapped into the storage compartment. I literally cannot use the mixer anymore because the beaters fall out. I probably used it a total of 10 times at the most.
customer_reviews.author: Linda D.

customer_reviews.title: Compact and powerful--great addition to your kitchen toolkit
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes you just don’t want to haul out the Kitchen Aide stand mixer for a modest job. This appliance fills the bill nicely. It is compact, lightweight, and easy to use and store. The design is thoughtful making use intuitive. I have had none of the difficulties written about in some reviews. It has plenty of speed and power to stand up to thick almond-butter batters. It handily creams butter with sugar. Whipping cream is a snap. I’m very pleased with all of the attachments especially the whisk, which is compact enough to use in a measuring cup or even a wide glass. I have not tried the bread hook, just FYI.
customer_reviews.author: J. Conklin

customer_reviews.title: Beaters collapsed on themselves on second use
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Seemed like a great mixer the first time I used it, but the second time I was using it, the beaters imploded while mixing cookie dough. How can a hand mixer not handle cookie dough? Now I have a mixer that I paid $80 for that's useless unless I pay $15.50 for another set of beaters (which won't likely be any better than the beaters that came with the mixer).
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Mix it Up!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: stores tools inside casing with mixer comes with several attachment tools easy to use multiple speeds to choose from Cons: I haven't any I would recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Chase E McKee

customer_reviews.title: Powerful hand mixer
customer_reviews.text: Things I love: More powerful than most; multi tools make it easy to work with any food or liquid; slow start prevents splashing; fairly light weight; longer cord than most; easy to store Thing I'm not too crazy about: Because it's well made, including the cord, there's not much flexibility and it sometimes gets in the way... even though you can position it to the right or left.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn S

customer_reviews.title: Easily stored, great little mixer
customer_reviews.text: Used for whipping cream and for making cookie dough. Love that everything goes into the plastic base. Easy storage.
customer_reviews.author: Movin' southTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great Helper in the Kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: I actually purchased this product back in 2015 and it is still working perfectly for me! Great power and easy to clean - made my kitchen work a lot quicker and easier!
customer_reviews.author: Malexxxxx

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Another item I bought for my daughter because I have one...I love mine & really like the storage container that snaps on the bottom brilliant idea!!
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Nice general use hand mixer.
customer_reviews.text: Like the compact easy to use for general quick mixing. i.e. cake batter, whip cream... similar density batters Nice that you can store all the attachments in one convenient grab.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Mann

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart handheld mixer is the one and only to have at hand!
customer_reviews.text: Cuisinart's handheld mixer's performance from blending to major mixing is the utmost to home use. The cleaning of this mixer is easy and efficient. Having the storage container holding all the parts and fitting into cabinets is like having a sundae with the "cherry" on top.
customer_reviews.author: Pg

customer_reviews.title: Worth your money and it doesn't burn a hole in your wallet/purse!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time using a hand mixer and it was a great decision and purchase. The reviews help me determine if this would be a good fit for first time users. It's light weight, it's powerful, easy to clean up, the Manuel booklet has recipes and tells you the speed settings.
customer_reviews.author: S3np@i

customer_reviews.title: Superpowerful
customer_reviews.text: I've used this mixer for everything - from beating egg whites to mixing very heavy dough. It seems to be as powerful as my big stand mixer. I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: norskemum

customer_reviews.title: Works great so far.
customer_reviews.text: We've only had this mixer since Thanksgiving, but it has plenty of power, nice attachments, and it works like it's supposed to. I expect it to last for many, many years so we'll see how that works out.
customer_reviews.author: Roy D. Lubkeman

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money, stopped working after less than 20 uses.
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the money. Broke in less than six months. Malfunction with circuit, mixer will no longer spin and when it shuts off it delays a red LED light instead of cutting off completely. I noticed that you can't find this model anymore (coincidentally). And now they market a similar model 90bcs it's the same one. The brand is not reliable. Going to purchase KitchenAid or another higher quality mixer. Tried to go for cheaper but you get what you pay for in this case.
customer_reviews.author: Lilly Wells

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy Cusinart!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I hate this mixer it is not worth the $60.00 I spent. I could have bought a cheeper one at Wal-Mart. Called Cuisinart and the customer service was terrible. I cant believe Amazon would sell such a cheep product.
customer_reviews.author: Linda not happy

customer_reviews.title: The best beaters on the market!
customer_reviews.text: I bake almost daily so I use and then clean my tools constantly. The wide-spaced beaters are a cinch to clean. I also like the fact that the motor automatically starts on (1) and then can. E increased. Y the user at will. Buttons and levers are easily accessed. This mixer is truly the best one I have ever purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this mixer.
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this mixer a few times, but it's worked great so far. The beaters look light weight, and I was worried that they wouldn't stand up to heavier chores, but there's been no problem. Though it isn't as quiet as a stand mixer, the Cuisinart is much quieter than the Proctor Silex mixer it's replacing. There's a good range of speeds, and when you need to add ingredients, the mixer has a squared end rest. I love that the beaters are stored neatly under the mixer. I would definitely recommend this mixer.
customer_reviews.author: jeansattic

customer_reviews.title: mixing things uo now
customer_reviews.text: things are getting really mixed up now and the instrument that you sent can get theings done
customer_reviews.author: Randy A.

customer_reviews.title: does the job. cutting. grinding, chopping quickly
customer_reviews.text: Happy with product after 6 months. Chops garlic and onions which is difficult for me with knife.
customer_reviews.author: Roz

customer_reviews.title: Great hand mixer for the price
customer_reviews.text: Thanks to other Amazon reviewers who pointed out that Kitchen Aid products have declined in quality in the past several years, I chose this Cuisinart mixer instead. Took awhile to get the hang of affixing the beaters, but once I figured it out everything went well, from mixing thick cookie dough to creating smooth as silk buttercream in less time than I thought possible with a hand beater. Great value!
customer_reviews.author: Ydeningyre

customer_reviews.title: excellent quality and value
customer_reviews.text: Works really well in all types of blending situations; I love that you can store all of the tools in the bottom container to keep everything together. Good value for the money!
customer_reviews.author: jk888

customer_reviews.title: Exactly the Mixer Needed
customer_reviews.text: We use it a lot. I love it, and can't think of any negatives to write about.
customer_reviews.author: Rutlander

customer_reviews.title: The on off button got a crack  after third time usage! Very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I got this in March 2020 and literally made only 2 wonderful cakes with it. I was very excited about the ease of use and the price. However, I noticed that the on-off button has a crack. It was not dropped and I am not sure how it can happened after using it for only two times! It seems that it was made poorly and Quality Control was not done properly.
customer_reviews.author: moutainview_cypress

customer_reviews.title: Well made product!
customer_reviews.text: I had this mixer for at least 14 years before I had to replace it with the newer model. I used it often for cookies and other misc mixing home. I have bought them as gifts as well. A great purchase for my kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy attachments and heavy vibration while mixing
customer_reviews.text: Very flimsy beaters, actually bent one trying to put it in mixer. The vibration from the mixer made it difficult to mix the batter I was making. I bought this for the genius storage container it comes with. I've never spent this much money on a mixer but decided to splurge because of the storage capability. Where the storage exceeds any on the market the quality of the mixer itself falls short for even the recreational cake maker like myself.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love this hand mixer. Had a kitchen aid prior to this one and this one is by far easier to use and the quality is great. Love using this for baking
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Khan

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected but trick in attaching clear storage container.
customer_reviews.author: James Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: The mixer is easy to use and has several speeds which make it easy to blend ingredients.
customer_reviews.text: I am at home because of the stay at home rules and needed a blender to do some baking but did not want to go out. I ordered the blender and it arrived as promised and in good condition. I immediately tried it out and it works very well. I like that it has several speeds which makes it easy to blend ingredients. It is easy to clean and everything stores together. I will purchase from this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara A. Clayton

customer_reviews.title: Part falling apart?
customer_reviews.text: Why there is a hole always to lose? One tool always falling apart when I use it...
customer_reviews.author: wendy06660shu

product_meta.title: Cuisinart HM-90S Power Advantage Plus 9-Speed Handheld Mixer with Storage Case, White
product_meta.description: Color:WhiteIntroducing a hand mixer that's as easy to put away as it is to operate. The Cuisinart Power Advantage Plus 9 Speed Hand Mixer performs any task a recipe calls for, and then tucks into its own storage case. Once it has mixed heavy batters, whipped up fluffy meringues and kneaded homemade bread dough, just clean it up and put it away. Extra long beaters, chef's whisk, and dough hooks fit into a clear case, and the mixer snaps on top. Plenty of power, perfect control, and compact storage. That's a mixer anyone can love.
feature_bullets: Handheld mixer with 220-watt motor and automatic feedback
Simple on/off button; 1-touch speed control and 9 speed options,BPA Free
3 low start speeds to prevent ingredients from splattering; snap-on clear storage case
Includes beaters, chef's whisk, dough hooks, spatula, and instruction/recipe book
Product Built to North American Electrical Standards
NOTE: Refer the User Manual before use.

specifications.Department: Cuisinart Power Advantage Plus 9-Speed Hand Mixer
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars3,738 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
